stem: Given question: James and Ruth were getting a divorce.  It was amicable, but it wasn't happy.  There was a lot of what emotion? and answer: sadness, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Divorces are difficult, and even the amicable ones are sad as they signify the end of relationships.
150_to_200_words:
The divorce of James and Ruth was amicable, but not a happy one. This means that even though they were able to agree on the terms of their divorce without getting into any arguments, it was not a joyous event for either of them.

The emotion that would most likely be present in this situation is sadness. James and Ruth were once in love and had been together for a long time, so it would be only natural for both of them to feel a sense of loss at the end of their relationship. They may feel sorrow for the memories they shared and the life they had built together, as well as regret for not being able to make their relationship work.

The sadness may also be compounded by the fact that the divorce is amicable. This would mean that there is no one to blame for the failed relationship, and both of them would likely feel guilty for not being able to save it. On top of that, they may be mourning the end of their marriage and the future that they had planned for themselves.

Overall, the divorce of James and Ruth would be a bittersweet experience. It is likely that both of them would feel a lot of sadness, as they come to terms with the end of their relationship and all of
